turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Doina.
turn.2: Doina The doina () is a Romanian musical tune style, possibly with Middle Eastern roots, customary in Romanian peasant music, as well as in Lăutărească.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It was also adopted into Klezmer music.
turn.5: why was it adopted into klezmer music?
turn.6: Similar tunes are found throughout Eastern Europe and the Balkans.
turn.7: what are some of the similarities?
turn.8: In some parts of the Balkans this kind of music is referred to as "scaros" or "scaru".
turn.9: what do you find to be the most interesting fact?
turn.10: Béla Bartók discovered the "doina" in Northern Transylvania in 1912 and he believed it to be uniquely Romanian.
turn.11: what happened after he discovered it?
turn.12: After he found similar genres in Ukraine, Albania, Algeria, Middle East and Northern India, he came to the belief that these are part of a family of related genres of Arabo-Persian origin.
